main event: A UFO sighting occurred on October 13, 1954 near Festus, Missouri. The object was described as a flat cylinder with changing colors and estimated at 12 to 14 inches in diameter and 1 inch thickness, before disappearing in a brilliant rectangular shape at high speed, leaving the witness feeling perplexed.
interesting points: The object was initially observed as yellowish-white, then changed rapidly to a brilliant white light with a distinct cloudy or hazy green color on the underside.
It was estimated to be solid, opaque, and about 12 to 14 inches in diameter, resembling a paper or white plastic plate.
The witness noticed no trail or exhaust, and no discernible sound from the object.
The object seemed to accelerate, change course, and disappear in a brilliant rectangle at high speed, leaving the witness unable to fully explain its behavior.
The witness reported feeling perplexed and initially thought the object may have been a picnic plate, but upon analysis, found the occurrence to be unexplainable by natural means.
sighted object: flat cylinder UFO with changing colors
